name: Classic Tomato Pasta
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook pasta until al dente.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a pan and sauté chopped onion until translucent.
Add minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Stir in chopped tomatoes and simmer for 8–10 minutes; season with salt and pepper.
Drain pasta, add to the sauce with torn basil, and toss to coat.
Serve hot with extra basil and a drizzle of olive oil.

name: Grilled Chicken Salad
instructions: Season chicken with salt and pepper; grill or pan-sear until cooked through.
Let chicken rest, then slice thinly.
Chop romaine, tomato, and cucumber; add to a large bowl.
Whisk olive oil and lemon juice with a pinch of salt for dressing.
Toss vegetables with dressing; top with sliced chicken and serve.

name: Spicy Beef Tacos
instructions: Brown ground beef in a skillet; drain excess fat.
Stir in cumin, paprika, salt, and a spoon of salsa; simmer 3–4 minutes.
Warm taco shells; fill with beef, shredded lettuce, cheese, and jalapeños.
Serve with extra salsa.

name: Vegetable Stir-fry
instructions: Heat oil in a wok; add minced garlic and ginger; stir for 20 seconds.
Add sliced vegetables; stir-fry over high heat until crisp-tender.
Splash in soy sauce; toss to coat; finish with a few drops of sesame oil.
Serve immediately with rice or noodles.

name: Herb Omelette
instructions: Whisk eggs with a splash of milk, salt, and pepper.
Melt butter in a nonstick pan over medium heat.
Pour in eggs; gently stir, then smooth into an even layer.
Sprinkle herbs; fold omelette and cook to desired doneness.

name: Garlic Butter Shrimp
instructions: Pat shrimp dry; season with salt and pepper.
Melt butter in a skillet; sauté garlic until fragrant.
Add shrimp; cook until pink, 1–2 minutes per side.
Finish with lemon juice and chopped parsley; serve.

name: Quinoa Buddha Bowl
instructions: Cook quinoa according to package directions; fluff with a fork.
Roast sweet potato cubes until tender; season lightly.
Whisk tahini with lemon juice, water, and salt to make a dressing.
Assemble bowl with quinoa, chickpeas, spinach, sweet potato; drizzle dressing.

name: Beef Bolognese
instructions: Sauté onion, carrot, and celery in olive oil until softened.
Add ground beef; cook until browned; stir in tomato paste.
Add canned tomatoes; simmer 25–30 minutes; season to taste.
Serve over pasta with grated cheese.

name: Creamy Mushroom Risotto
instructions: Heat broth in a pot; keep warm.
Sauté onion and mushrooms in olive oil; add garlic briefly.
Stir in rice; toast 1–2 minutes; deglaze with wine.
Add warm broth a ladle at a time, stirring until absorbed; repeat until creamy.
Finish with butter and parmesan; season and serve.

name: Pan-Seared Salmon
instructions: Pat salmon dry; season with salt and pepper.
Heat oil in a skillet; sear salmon skin-side down until crisp; flip and finish.
Add minced garlic and lemon slices; baste briefly; serve with dill.

name: Margherita Pizza
instructions: Preheat oven with a stone to 250°C/480°F.
Stretch dough; spread tomato sauce thinly.
Top with torn mozzarella and basil; drizzle olive oil and season.
Bake until crust is blistered and cheese melted.

name: Lentil Soup
instructions: Sauté onion, carrot, and celery; add garlic and cumin briefly.
Stir in tomato paste; add lentils and broth; simmer until tender.
Blend partially for creaminess; finish with lemon juice and salt.

name: Thai Green Curry
instructions: Sauté curry paste in a little oil until fragrant.
Add coconut milk; bring to a simmer; add chicken and vegetables.
Cook until chicken is done; season with fish sauce; finish with basil.

name: Tofu Peanut Noodles
instructions: Cook noodles according to package; rinse briefly.
Pan-fry tofu cubes until golden; season lightly.
Whisk peanut butter, soy sauce, lime juice, and chili flakes with warm water.
Toss noodles with sauce, tofu, and sliced scallions; serve.

name: Greek Yogurt Parfait
instructions: Layer yogurt in a glass; drizzle with honey.
Add granola and fresh berries; garnish with mint; serve cold.

name: BBQ Pulled Pork Sandwich
instructions: Slow-cook pork with onion and garlic until fork-tender.
Shred pork; toss with BBQ sauce.
Pile onto toasted buns; top with coleslaw; serve.

name: Caprese Salad
instructions: Slice tomatoes and mozzarella; layer with basil leaves.
Drizzle olive oil and balsamic; season with salt and pepper; serve.

name: Shakshuka
instructions: Sauté onion and pepper; add garlic, paprika, and cumin.
Add tomatoes; simmer until thickened.
Make wells; crack eggs; cover and cook until set to preference.

name: Teriyaki Chicken Rice Bowl
instructions: Whisk soy sauce, mirin, sugar, ginger, and garlic for teriyaki sauce.
Cook chicken; pour in sauce; simmer to thicken and glaze.
Serve over steamed rice with blanched broccoli.

name: Veggie Chili
instructions: Sauté onion and pepper; add garlic, chili powder, and cumin.
Add beans and tomatoes; simmer 25–30 minutes; season to taste.
Serve with toppings like cilantro or sour cream (optional).

name: Pesto Pasta with Chicken
instructions: Blend basil, pine nuts, parmesan, garlic, olive oil, and lemon juice to make pesto.
Cook pasta; reserve some pasta water.
Sear sliced chicken until cooked; toss pasta with pesto, chicken, and a splash of pasta water.
Serve with extra parmesan.
